translation: The plower answered, 'This is my business; I'll plant seeds in it, and later I'll obtain grain to feed myself and deliver it to the king's home.'

translation: They all replied,'catching birds and animals to help themselves.'

translation: The princes again asked, and each answered, 'I'll look up to this fish for clothing and food.'

source_sentence: 進止道路，汝從是去，前當有城，其城極妙，七寶雜廁。
translation: Entering and stopping on the road, depart from here. There will be a city in front of you. That city will be most wonderful, decorated with storehouses made of the seven kinds of treasure.

source_sentence: 汝到城門，城門若閉，其城門邊，有金剛杵，汝便取杵，以撞其門。
translation: On the side of the city gate is a vajra, so you take it and smash it into the city gate.

source_sentence: 城中當有五百天女，各齎寶珠，來用奉汝，更有一女，最特尊勝，所持寶珠，
translation: In the city there will be five hundred heavenly maidens, each carrying a precious pearl, who will come to offer it to you.

source_sentence: 而有紺色，名旃陀摩尼。
translation: Instead, there's a dark blue color that's called the caṇḍa maṇi.

source_sentence: 此如意珠，得便堅持，勿令失脫，其餘與者，亦可取之。
translation: If you obtain this wish-granting jewel, then hold on to it and don't let it lose its freedom; anyone else who gives it to you can also take it.

source_sentence: 攝錄諸根，勿復與語。
translation: Record the faculties, and don't talk to them again.

source_sentence: 我今轉極，餘命少少，若命終後，念識我恩，對我發哀，埋此沙中。』
translation: Now that I'm going to the limit, my remaining life is limited, and if my life ends, you'll think of me as a benefactor and bury me in this sand with compassion.'

source_sentence: 導師語竟，氣絕命終。
translation: When the Master finished speaking, his vitality died.

source_sentence: 對之悲慟，為之葬埋，隨其所教，前進而去。
translation: They grieved for him and buried him in the ground. Following what they had been told, they came forward and departed.

source_sentence: 到七寶城，城門堅閉，見金剛杵在其門邊，如語取杵以撞其門，城門便開。
translation: When he arrived at the city of the seven treasures, the city gates were firmly shut, and when he saw the vajra standing beside the gates, he said, Take the vajra and smash it through the gates, and the city gates opened.

source_sentence: 五百天女，各持寶珠，來奉太子。
translation: Five hundred heavenly maidens, each holding a precious pearl, came to present it to the prince.

source_sentence: 最前一女，手所持珠，如語紺色，隨次第攝取，裹在衣角，便旋還來。
translation: The first woman in front of him, holding the pearl in his hand, looked as she said. It was a dark blue color; he collected it one by one and wrapped it around the corners of her robe. Then he came back again and again.

source_sentence: 「前太子別後，波婆伽梨復語眾人：『行來不易，但當多取。』
translation: After the former prince's departure, Upagupta again said to the crowd, 'It's not easy to come and go; you must simply take a lot.'

source_sentence: 眾人貪寶，取之過度。
translation: The people coveted the treasure and excessively grasped it.

source_sentence: 太子還到，其船已滿，放船還來，船便沈沒，諸賈人輩，乍沈乍浮，太子已有如意珠，
translation: When the prince returned home, his boat was already full. He dismounted and came back again and again, but the boat sank and sank. The merchants were both sunken and floating at the same time. The prince already possessed the wish-granting jewel.

source_sentence: 故身不沒溺。
translation: Therefore, his body isn't submerged in drowning.

source_sentence: 波婆伽梨遙喚太子：『當見救濟，勿便捐棄。』
translation: Upagupta called the prince from a distance, 'Shouldn't you abandon it if you see someone to rescue him?'

source_sentence: 太子聞語，即牽共浮，力勵相挽，便得出海。
translation: When the prince heard these words, they floated together and pulled each other out of the sea.

source_sentence: 出海之後，弟語兄言：『我曹兄弟，辭父母來，入於大海，望不空歸。
translation: After leaving the sea, his younger brother said to his elder brothers, “My brothers have left their parents and are entering the great sea.

source_sentence: 際遇不諧，喪失財寶，單身空到，甚可恥也。』
translation: Whenever he meets someone who doesn't harmonize, he loses his possessions and treasures, and it's shameful that he's left alone in an empty place.'

source_sentence: 迦良那伽梨天性忠直，即語弟言：『我故得寶。』
translation: Kālyāyanakara's nature was loyal and straightforward, so he said to his disciples, 'That's why I got the treasure.'

source_sentence: 弟語兄言：『當用見示。』
translation: The younger brother said to his elder brother, 'Should you show it to him?'

source_sentence: 即解衣裏以珠示之。
translation: He then untied his robe and showed it to him with a pearl.

source_sentence: 弟得見珠，因而懷情，『念我父王恩慈不普，偏愛我兄，我不在意；
translation: Seeing the jewel, the younger brother cherished feelings of affection and thought to himself, “I am thinking of my father. The king’s kindness and compassion are not universal; he loves my brother only partially but does not care about me.

source_sentence: 今我二人，俱來入海，兄得異寶，我獨空歸。
translation: Now the two of us have both entered the sea together. The elder brother has obtained an extraordinary treasure and I am returning alone in vain.

source_sentence: 從是已後，當賤遇我，我當云何？
translation: From then on, I will be treated with contempt. What shall I do?

source_sentence: 因其臥寐，陰殺其兄，取其珠寶，歸語父王言，其兄沒海，於是乃當異愛念我。』
translation: As he was lying asleep, he secretly killed his brother, took his jewelry, returned to his father and king, and said, 'That brother has disappeared into the sea, so I'll be loved by him.'

source_sentence: 作是念已，密自懷計，語其兄言：『人村漸近，我曹兄弟，不應俱眠，
translation: Having thought thus, he said to his elder brother in secret: As the village grows closer together, my two brothers should not sleep together.

source_sentence: 宜更坐守護持寶珠。』
translation: It's better to sit down again and guard the precious pearl.'

source_sentence: 兄即然之，常共更守。
translation: The elder brother then told him to do so, and they always guarded it together.

source_sentence: 波婆伽梨，次應休眠，臥地經時，極過常度，然後乃起。
translation: Pāvāgāriputra, you should then go to sleep. When you lie on the ground and walk upright for a long time, you must cross over [to your bed] at an extreme speed before you can get up.

source_sentence: 兄復次臥，由坐久故，睡寐極著。
translation: The elder brother lay down in turn. Because he had been sitting there for a long time, he fell asleep and became very sleepy.

source_sentence: 波婆伽梨，起入林中，林中有樹，其刺極利，即取兩枚，各長尺五，持來兄邊，
translation: Pāvāgāriputra rose and entered the forest. There was a tree in the forest whose thorns were so sharp that he took two pieces, each one five feet long, and carried them to his brother’s side.

source_sentence: 兄眠甚重，一手捉刺，當其眼宕，刺令沒刺，收寶而去。
translation: When his brother was seriously ill asleep, he grasped the thorn in one hand and withdrew it into his eyes. The thorn caused him to no longer pierced [the arrow]; then he collected the treasures and departed.

source_sentence: 太子苦痛，高聲急喚：『波婆伽梨！
translation: The prince was so pained that he shouted loudly and urgently, 'Bāvarī!

source_sentence: 波婆伽梨！
translation: Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 此中有賊。』
translation: Here, there's a thief.'

source_sentence: 喚經數返無有應者。
translation: There are no responses to the repeated calls for the sūtras.

source_sentence: 「爾時樹神語太子言：『波婆伽梨，是汝之賊，刺汝眼竟，持汝珠去。』
translation: It was then that the tree spirit said to the prince, 'Bāvarī, this is your thief who pierced your eyes and took your beads away.'

source_sentence: 於是太子宛轉辛苦，匍匐而行，漸小前進，到梨師䟦陀國。
translation: Then the prince, overcome with distress and exhaustion, licked his feet and proceeded gradually. He reached the country of Risikhanda.

source_sentence: 至於澤宕，值五百頭牛來到其邊，有一牛王，見於太子，憐敬兼懷，出舌舐之，
translation: On arriving in the marsh, he met five hundred oxen that came alongside him. When a king of cows saw the prince, they all cherished feelings of pity and veneration for him, licking his flesh with their tongues.

source_sentence: 餘牛悉集，愕住共視。
translation: The other cows all gathered together and stood in terror, looking at each other.

source_sentence: 時牧牛人，來前試看，乃覩太子臥在于地，見其眼中，有是長刺，觀其形相，
translation: The cowherd came before the prince to test him. He saw that he was lying on the ground, with a long thorn in his eye and looked at his form.

source_sentence: 又知非凡，即為拔刺，將至住處，常以酥乳，著其瘡中，飲食供給，隨其瞻養。
translation: Knowing that he was not an ordinary man, he pulled out the thorns and went to his dwelling place. He always placed butter and milk in the sores [to remove the thorns] and provided him with food and drink to look after them.

source_sentence: 復經數時，眼瘡漸差，主人承事，未曾懈廢。
translation: After a few moments the eye sores gradually disappeared. The host, who was attending to the Master’s business, never tired of doing so.

source_sentence: 爾時太子，問牧牛人：『汝居此中，有何基業？』
translation: It was then that the prince asked the cowherd, 'Where are you staying here? What's the foundation for your business?'

source_sentence: 牧牛人答：『我在此中，無有基業，唯仰乳酪，賣用自濟。』
translation: The cowherd replied, 'Here, I have no foundational business but look to milk and cheese for my own profit.'

source_sentence: 太子自念：『我遭困厄，勞煩主人，恒供養我。
translation: The prince thought to himself, 'I'm in distress and troubled by my host, so I'll always be offered support.

source_sentence: 今者瘡差，小能行來，當更方宜求易處所。』
translation: Now that the sores are healed, it's better to seek a place of ease in another place where he can walk.'

source_sentence: 念是事已，因語主人：『爾所時節，共相勞煩，感念主人，恩難酬報。
translation: After thinking about this, he said to his host, 'At such a time and season, we're both tormented by the trouble, and it's difficult to repay the kindness of our host.

source_sentence: 我欲前行，到於城中，展轉行乞，以自供活。』
translation: Wishing to go ahead, I'll go to the city and beg for my support in turn.'

source_sentence: 時牧牛舍主，聞太子言，懼其舍內妻子奴婢有餘厭辭聞太子耳，『若其不爾，
translation: The owner of the cowherd’s dwelling at that time heard what the prince said. Fearful that his wife, children, and servants inside the hut might have some residual sense of disgust, he said to the prince, “If you don’t do so,

source_sentence: 何緣乃辭？』
translation: What's the reason for saying so?'

source_sentence: 作是念已，先問舍內：『汝曹有何不稱之事，而令貴客辭欲索去？』
translation: After he had this thought, he first asked Śāriputra, 'What's the thing that you don't praise that causes the noble guest to leave and want to ask for it?'

source_sentence: 舍內皆言：『我曹於此如兄如弟，不知何緣欲相捨去？』
translation: The monks inside the house all said, 'Here, we're like brothers and brothers, so we don't know why we want to abandon each other.'

source_sentence: 於時舍主，語太子言：『我相承侍，未有不稱，不可捨我轉行餘乞。』
translation: The owner of the monastery then said to the prince, 'We'll serve each other, but there's nothing we won't call, so you can't abandon me and go around begging for anything else.'

source_sentence: 於時太子，聞舍主語，見其慇懃，恒護其意，且小停住。
translation: The prince then heard the words of the householder and saw that he was angry, so he always guarded his thoughts and stayed quietly.

source_sentence: 復經數時，便語主人：『汝供待我，隨時無乏，家內一切，接我隆厚。
translation: After a few moments, he said to his host,'Make offerings to me at any time without deficiency, and all the people in my house will take care of me with great generosity.

source_sentence: 但我意中，自欲轉行到前城中，望遣一人，將我共往。』
translation: In my mind, however, I want to go on my way to the city in front of me, hoping to send a man to go with me.'

source_sentence: 時牧牛人，見其慇懃，恐違其意令其心愁，躬自將護，共至城中。
translation: When the cowherd saw this, he was afraid that it would disobey his wishes and cause him to become sad. He protected himself and went into the city together.

source_sentence: 已到彼城，共別當還，太子語言：『汝哀我者，買索一琴，與我自娛。』
translation: After arriving in that city, they'll return together and say goodbye, and the prince says, 'If you pity me, buy a lute and offer it to me for my entertainment.'

source_sentence: 時牧牛人，尋買索與，共相辭謝，於時別去。
translation: The cowherd then asked for it and gave it to him. They said goodbye together and departed at the same time.

source_sentence: 「爾時太子，素多伎能，歌頌文辭，極善巧妙，即於陌宕，激聲歌頌，
translation: At that time the prince, who was well versed in both arts and crafts, singing hymns of praise and words composed with utmost skillfulness, sang these hymns of praise at the top of the steep path.

source_sentence: 彈琴以和，音甚清雅，城中人民，聞其音者皆樂聽觀，無有厭足，各持飲食，
translation: They played the lute in harmony and their voices were very clear and elegant. All the citizens of the city who heard the sound of the lute enjoyed listening to it, never tiring of eating or drinking.

source_sentence: 競來與之。
translation: They rushed to give it to him.

source_sentence: 時城中有五百乞兒，皆來依附，賴其飽食。
translation: At the time, there were five hundred beggar children in the city who came to rely on him for food and drink.

source_sentence: 梨師䟦王，有一園監，為王監守果[木*奈]之園。
translation: In the kingdom of Li Siṃhala, there was a park superintendent who guarded the fruit [munai] park for the king.

source_sentence: [木*奈]有熟者，鸚鵡來食，手力不周，不能驚遮。
translation: [munai] has a cooked one, and a parrot comes to eat it, but his hand is too weak to cover it with fear.

source_sentence: 於時園監，檐[木*奈]與王，其中好[木*奈]，鸚鵡啄壞，王見瞋恚，
translation: At that time the superintendent of the monastery gave the eaves [mu*nai] to the king, who liked [mu*nai] among them. The parrot pecked at it and destroyed it.

source_sentence: 欲加刑罰。
translation: They want to impose punishment.

source_sentence: 園監惶怖，向王自陳：『家乏人力故使爾耳，唯見寬恕，原匂刑罰，當索守人，
translation: Frightened, the guards of the monastery said to the king, “There is no one else in my house who can do so.” The king told them, “Your majesty, we are short of men.

source_sentence: 更不令爾。』
translation: I won't allow you to do so.'

source_sentence: 王便恕置，不問其罪。
translation: The king then for pardoned him and didn't ask about his sins.

source_sentence: 園監得脫，行求索人，見迦良那伽梨，匂於道邊，觀其形相，似是忠人，
translation: When the superintendent of the monastery had escaped, he went out to search for a beggar. Seeing Kālyāyanakara, he smelled the odor at the side of the road and looked as if he was a loyal man.

source_sentence: 即語之曰：『汝能為我看守園不？
translation: He said to them, 'Can you guard the park for me?'

source_sentence: 汝若能者，當供所乏。』
translation: If you can, you'll make offerings to what's lacking.'

source_sentence: 太子答言：『我眼無見，云何看守？』
translation: The prince answered, 'My eyes don't see, so how can I guard them?'

source_sentence: 園監語言：『汝苟欲看，雖復無眼，當作方便，多作細繩，繫諸樹端，
translation: The superintendent of the monastery said, “If you wish to see but do not have eyes, use skillful means and often make small ropes around the branches of the trees.

source_sentence: 以諸鈴物，連繫相著，展轉相牽汝捉一頭；
translation: The objects of the bells are bound together in chains, one after another, pulling each other to take hold of your head.

source_sentence: 若聞有聲，汝便頓繩，鸚鵡驚怖無緣得住。』
translation: If you hear a sound, you'll suddenly fall into a rope, and the parrot will be frightened and have no reason to stay.'

source_sentence: 太子聞語，而答之言：『若有此事，我能為之。』
translation: The prince heard what he said and answered, 'If there's such a thing, I can do it.'

source_sentence: 共相可竟，即往為守。
translation: Together, they can finish each other’s deeds and immediately go to keep watch over the guardians.

source_sentence: 「時波婆伽梨，到父王國，王怪獨來，即問消息。
translation: When Pāvāgāriputra arrived in his father's kingdom, the king wondered if he had come alone and asked for news.

source_sentence: 波婆伽梨，而語王言：『我曹不遇，船重沈沒，迦良那伽梨并諸賈人，
translation: Pāvāgāriputra said to the king, “I am unable to meet you.

source_sentence: 合諸珍寶，盡沒大海。
translation: Together with all the treasures and jewels, they completely disappeared into the great ocean.

source_sentence: 我力勵浮，趣得全濟。』
translation: I'm motivated by my strength to float, and I'll attain complete salvation.'

source_sentence: 王及夫人，聞是語已，悶絕良久，無所覺識，以水灑面，困乃還穌。
translation: Having heard these words, the king and his queen fainted in distress for a long time. Without knowing anything, they sprinkled their faces with water and returned to sleep in distress.

source_sentence: 宮閤內外諸王臣民，聞此事者，莫不悲悼。
translation: All the kings and their officials, both inside and outside the palace, who heard this story were grieved.

source_sentence: 王及夫人，語波婆伽梨：『迦梨太子沒海，汝何以來？
translation: The king and his wife said to Pāvākara,'prince Kālīputra, where have you been since you sank in the sea?'

source_sentence: 何不并就死大海中？』
translation: Why isn't it combined with the great ocean of death?'

source_sentence: 合土人民，無不痛惜，朝夕哭戀，如喪父母。
translation: The people of the whole land grieved, weeping and crying day and night in sorrow, just as if they had lost their parents.

source_sentence: 太子在宮，常愛一鴈，王告其鴈：『太子養汝，今入大海，奄沒不還，
translation: When the prince was in the palace, he always loved food and drink. The king told the cook, “Your majesty, you were raised by the prince; but now you have entered the great sea and are drowning without returning.

source_sentence: 何不往看，知其所在？』
translation: Why don't you go and see him and know where he is?'

source_sentence: 因作書音，以繫鴈項。
translation: That's why he made a calligraphy to bind it around his neck.

source_sentence: 鴈即高翔，廣行求覓，遊彼園上，識其歌聲，即下試看，得見太子，鳴聲悲喜，
translation: So he flew up high and traveled widely in search of the prince. When he saw the sound of his singing, he went down to see it for a second time. Seeing the Prince, he cried out in sorrow and joy.

source_sentence: 不能自勝。
translation: They can't overcome themselves.

source_sentence: 太子聞識，即解取書，眼無所見不能看讀，因求紙筆作書與王，說波婆伽梨刺眼委曲，
translation: When the prince heard this, he untied his book and took it. His eyes did not see anything that he could not read. So he asked for a piece of paper to write to the king [and told him]: “I am going to recite the prātimokṣatriya śrāvaka’s true words.” The thick-tongured hair on the crown prince’s eyebrows

source_sentence: 所更歷處，辛酸諸事。
translation: Wherever he went, there were many painful and distressing events.

source_sentence: 繫於鴈項，鴈便飛去。
translation: He tied it around his neck and flew away.

source_sentence: 「梨師䟦王，時有一女，端政殊妙，世間希有，王甚愛重，不違其意。
translation: “At one time there was a queen of the Li Siṃhala king’s palace. Her appearance was marvelous and rare in the world. The king esteemed her very much and did not disobey her.

source_sentence: 時女辭王，出遊園觀，王便聽去。
translation: The queen then departed from the king’s palace and went out on a pleasure excursion to the pleasure park.

source_sentence: 女至園中，見於太子迦良那伽梨，頭亂面垢，目無所見，著弊壞衣，坐林樹間。
translation: When the woman went to the garden, she saw the prince Kālyāyanakara with his head in disarray and his face dirty, but her eyes didn't see anything. She was wearing a broken robe and sitting among trees in a forest.

source_sentence: 其女觀察，覩其色狀，心情屬向，不離其側，便坐其邊，與共談語。
translation: The woman observed the monk’s form and looked at him. Her heart was fixed on him, but she did not leave his side. So she sat beside him and talked to him.

source_sentence: 食時已到，王遣人喚，女還遣人白於王曰：『願送食來，欲就此食。』
translation: When it was time to eat, the king sent someone to summon him, and the woman returned with a messenger and said to the king, 'Please send food here; I want to take this food.'

source_sentence: 即送食來，女語太子：『我欲共汝一處坐食。』
translation: She then sent food, and the woman said to the prince, 'I want to share a place with you to sit and eat.'

source_sentence: 太子答言：『我是乞匂之人，汝是王女，云何共食？
translation: The prince answered, 'I'm the one who begs for a fragrance, so why are you the king's daughters eating together?

source_sentence: 王若聞者，罪我不少。』
translation: If the king hears it, I'll be guilty of not much offense.'

source_sentence: 其女慇懃，語太子言：『若汝不肯，我便不食。』
translation: The woman became angry and said to the prince, 'If you won't accept it, I won't eat it.'

source_sentence: 如是數返，逼迫不已，而便共食。
translation: They repeated this many times without stopping to oppress them, and then they ate together.

source_sentence: 言遂欵篤，意漸附近，目無去離。
translation: His speech became so acute that his thoughts gradually moved closer to him, and there was no separation of his eyes.

source_sentence: 日轉欲暮，王遣人喚女，女還遣人往白王曰：『我願為此守園人婦，不用其餘國王太子，
translation: As the sun was about to set, the king sent someone to summon the queen. The queen returned and said to the king, “I wish to be the wife of the garden keeper here without the use of any other royal prince or crown prince.

source_sentence: 今我專心，慇懃如是。
translation: Now, I'm concentrating my mind, and it's just like this.

source_sentence: 唯願父王！

translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying at Kapilavastu Monastery in Nirgrantha Monastery in Kapilavastu.

source_sentence: 佛初還國，於時諸釋，觀佛威儀，相好殊異，身體金色，三十二相，視之無厭，
translation: When the Buddha first returned to his own country, the monks observed the Buddha’s manner of deportment. His features were extraordinary; his body was golden in color and endowed with thirty-two distinctive marks. They looked at him tirelessly.

translation: Each of them joined the assembly in street corners and marketplaces, chanting with one voice to praise the Tathāgata. Among these people there was no different kind of debauchery; how venerable indeed it was!

translation: After hearing this treatise, the monks all reported it to the Buddha together and told him the words of praise that they had composed.

source_sentence: 於時世尊，告諸比丘：「汝等當知，吾乃往昔，於此眾中，最尊最妙，
translation: The World-honored One then said to the monks: You should know that in the past I was the most venerable and wonderful among all these bhikṣus.

translation: Not only today.

translation: The monks then each said to the Buddha, Not sure, Bhagavān!

translation: In a past life, he was the most honored and marvelous among these people, what did he do?

source_sentence: 爾時世尊，告諸比丘：「諦聽諦聽！
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the monks, Listen closely!

source_sentence: 善著心中，吾當為汝，具足解釋，過去世事。」
translation: Well concentrated in your mind, I will explain for you the events of past lives.

source_sentence: 對曰：「唯然，願樂欲聞。」
translation: He replied, Yes, I'd like to hear it.

source_sentence: 佛便為說：「過去無量，不可思議阿僧祇劫，此閻浮提，有大國王，名曰令奴，
translation: The Buddha then said to them: In the past, immeasurable, inconceivable, and incalculable kalpas ago, there was a great king named Ajātaśatru in Jambudvīpa.

source_sentence: 其王統領，八萬四千諸小國王，一萬大臣，五百太子，夫人婇女，合有二萬。
translation: The king ruled over eighty-four thousand small countries with ten thousand ministers, five hundred princes, and twenty thousand wives and court ladies.

source_sentence: 最大夫人，字提婆跋提，最後懷妊，生一太子，其兒端正，身紫金色，
translation: The oldest wife, named Devabhadra, was finally pregnant and gave birth to a prince. The prince was handsome with a purple-gold colored body.

source_sentence: 其髮紺青，兩手掌中，千輻輪相，其左足底，有馬形相，其右足底，有白象相。
translation: The base of the left foot has the shape of a horse, while the base of the right foot has the form of a white elephant.

source_sentence: 其兒福德，人中奇尊，即依父母，而為立字提婆令奴。
translation: Because of the merit of his son, he was a rare and honored among men. Relying on his parents, he made Deva (i.e., Kṣāntibhadra) to be his slave.

source_sentence: 乳哺長大，令奴大王，卒遇時病，其命將終，諸小國王，群臣太子，咸來問病。
translation: When he grew up she fed him milk and caused the prince to become a slave, but when he suddenly became ill and died, the kings of the small countries and their ministers and princes all came to inquire about his illness.

source_sentence: 因問大王：『假其終沒，諸王太子，誰應紹嗣？』
translation: He asked the great king, 'If he were to die, who would be the heir of the princes and princes?'

source_sentence: 時王報曰：『若我諸子，有能具足十功德者，乃立為王。
translation: The king then replied, 'If there are any of my children who can possess the ten virtues, they'll be established as king.

translation: What are these ten virtues?

source_sentence: 一者身紫金色，其髮紺青。
translation: The first is a purple-colored body, which is deep blue in color.

source_sentence: 二者兩手掌中，有金輪相，具足不缺。
translation: Second, in the palms of their hands there is a golden wheel [that appears to be] complete and not deficient.

source_sentence: 三者其右足底，有白象相。
translation: Third, the base of his right foot has the characteristic of a white elephant.

source_sentence: 四者其左足下，有馬形相。
translation: Fourth, beneath his left foot is the shape of a horse.

source_sentence: 五者著王衣服，與身相可，不大不小。
translation: The fifth is wearing the king’s clothes and agreeing with his body, neither too big nor too small.

source_sentence: 六者坐王御座，威德巍巍，其坐安隱。
translation: The sixth is the king’s royal throne, seated with great dignity and majesty. He sat in peace.

source_sentence: 七者諸王群臣，歡喜敬禮，稱善無量，入於後宮，夫人婇女，踊躍歡喜，
translation: The kings and their ministers were delighted, greeted with veneration, and praised him as immeasurable. Entering the rear quarters of the palace, the queens and court ladies danced and jumped for joy.

source_sentence: 作禮恭敬。
translation: They paid homage and respect.

source_sentence: 八者若將至於天祠，泥天木像，悉為作禮。
translation: Eight, if he goes to a deva shrine, he'll pay homage to all the mud and wooden images of the gods.

source_sentence: 九者福德威力，能雨七寶，稱給一切。
translation: The ninth is the power of blessedness and virtue, which rains seven treasures and praises them to all.

source_sentence: 十者其母是誰，提婆跋提夫人所生。
translation: (10) Who was the mother of Devadatta? She was born to a woman named Devadatta.

source_sentence: 若有具足是十功德，斯乃立之，用作大王。』
translation: If someone possesses these ten virtues, they'll establish them and use them as great kings.'

source_sentence: 教勅已竟，無常對至，遂便命終。
translation: Having completed his instructions, impermanent beings approached him and died.

source_sentence: 「諸王臣民，五百子中，從其大者，次以十事，觀相其身。
translation: “The king’s ministers and subjects, of the five hundred sons, the first to grow in size, next contemplated their bodies with ten things.

source_sentence: 此諸太子，身無金色，髮無紺青，手掌無輪，足底無有象馬之相；
translation: These princes had no golden bodies, no blue or white hair, no hands and feet, and no elephants or horses at the base of their feet.

source_sentence: 著王者服不相應當；
translation: Those who wear the king’s robe are not to be associated with it.

source_sentence: 坐于御座，其木師子，驚張起立，欲搏嚙之；
translation: He was seated at the royal throne. The wooden lions stood up in fear and wanted to attack him.

source_sentence: 諸王臣民，悉不敬禮；
translation: The king’s ministers and subjects all did not venerate him.

source_sentence: 將至宮內，夫人婇女，悉不歡喜，無禮敬者；
translation: When the Master was about to enter the palace, all the ladies and maidservants were neither delighted nor greeted.

source_sentence: 設入天祠，自禮天像，諸餘泥木天像，悉不作禮；
translation: Even if one enters a deva temple and pays homage to an image of the deity, no veneration is offered to other images of the earthen or wooden deities.

source_sentence: 語使雨寶，亦復不能；
translation: He said, “Even if the messengers rained down treasure they would not be able to do so.

source_sentence: 又復不是提婆跋提夫人所生。
translation: Again, it wasn't born by Lady Devabhadra.

source_sentence: 乃至五百諸大太子，於十事中，乃無一事。
translation: Even among the five hundred great princes, there's not a single thing in the ten things.

source_sentence: 最下小子，身紫金色，其髮紺青，看其兩手，輪相具足，覩其脚底，象形馬相，
translation: The youngest of them, with a purplish-gold colored body, looked like an elephant or a horse at the base of its legs.

source_sentence: 昞然如畫；
translation: Suddenly, it looked like a picture.

source_sentence: 著王法服，與身相可；
translation: They wore the king’s robe of the Dharma and were compatible with each other.

source_sentence: 坐於御座，福德巍巍；
translation: He was seated on the royal throne, majestic in virtue and splendor.

source_sentence: 諸王臣民，無不敬禮；
translation: The king’s ministers and subjects all paid their respects.

source_sentence: 入於後宮，夫人婇女，敬奉作禮；
translation: They entered the rear quarters of the palace, where their wives and concubines honored and paid homage to them.

source_sentence: 將至天祠，泥木天像，悉皆為禮；
translation: He was about to go to a deva temple and worshiped all the images of the gods in mud and wood.

source_sentence: 教使雨寶，始語即雨；
translation: He instructed his messengers to rain down treasure, and the first word he uttered was that it would rain.

source_sentence: 問是誰生？
translation: He asked, Who is it produced?

source_sentence: 提婆跋提夫人所生。
translation: It was produced by Lady Devabhadra.

source_sentence: 十事具足，諸王臣民，即拜為王。
translation: The king's ministers and subjects then bowed to him as king.

source_sentence: 至十五日，日初出時，有金輪寶，從東方來，輪有千輻，縱廣一由旬。
translation: On the fifteenth day, when the sun began to rise on the fifteenth day, there was a golden wheel of treasure that came from the east with a thousand spokes one yojana in length and breadth.

source_sentence: 王即下座，右膝著地，跪而言曰：『若我福德，應為王者，輪當稱我。』
translation: The king then descended from his seat, knelt with his right knee on the ground, knelt down, and said, 'If I'm a king by virtue, the wheel will call me.'

source_sentence: 即如其言，來在殿前，住虛空中。
translation: Then, just as he had said, they came in front of the hall and stayed in space.

source_sentence: 白象寶者，從香山來，毛尾貫珠，若王乘上，象皆能飛，從朝至午，徧四天下，
translation: The white elephant treasure comes from the mountain of fragrance, its hair and tail endowed with jewels. If the king rides on it, the elephant can fly from morning to noon through the four quarters of the earth.

source_sentence: 若以足行，足所觸地，即成金沙。
translation: If he walks with his feet and touches the ground with his feet, it becomes gold sand.

source_sentence: 紺馬寶者，身紺青色，其馬毛尾，皆悉珠色，皆雨七寶；
translation: The treasure of the dark-blue horse is a deep blue color on the body, with its hair and tail made of all kinds of jewels.

source_sentence: 若王乘上，一食之頃，遊四天下，不疲不勞。
translation: If the king rides on it, he travels through the four continents without weariness or fatigue for a single meal.

source_sentence: 神珠寶者，自然而至，其珠光明，晝夜恒照百二十里，內復能雨於七寶，
translation: The divine jewel came spontaneously, and its light shone day and night for a hundred or twenty li at all. It also rained the seven kinds of treasure from within as well.

source_sentence: 稱給一切。
translation: It's called giving to all.

source_sentence: 玉女寶者，自然而至，端正殊妙，稱適王意。
translation: The treasure of the jadelike queen came naturally and was so handsome and beautiful as to please the king’s wishes.

source_sentence: 典藏臣者，王須七寶，隨意給足，終無乏盡。
translation: The treasury treasurer's minister asked for seven treasures, and the king gave them to him as he wished without running out.

source_sentence: 其典兵臣，王若欲須四種兵時，顧視之頃，諸兵悉集，行陣嚴整，威力非凡。
translation: When the king wanted to require four kinds of troops, his military commander looked out for them and saw that all his troops were assembled. Their formations were well arrayed and their strength was not uncommon.

source_sentence: 七寶既具，坐自思惟：『吾享斯位，皆由前身宿種福業，乃致之耳，今當紹繼使不斷絕。』
translation: When the seven treasures were complete, he sat and thought to himself, 'I'll enjoy this position because of the merits I planted in my previous life that caused them to come into being, and now I'll continue to do so without stopping.'

source_sentence: 即以香湯，洗浴其身，著新淨衣，手執香爐，向于東方，跪而言曰：『東方快士，
translation: He then bathed his body with scented warm water, washed it, put on fresh and clean clothes, took a censer in his hand, faced the east, knelt down, and said:

source_sentence: 來受我請。』
translation: Come and accept my invitation.'

source_sentence: 即時便有二萬辟支佛，來至王宮；
translation: Immediately, twenty thousand pratyekabuddhas came to the royal palace.

source_sentence: 南西北方，悉皆請之，時有六萬辟支佛，來受王請。
translation: At that time sixty thousand pratyekabuddhas came to receive the king’s invitation.

source_sentence: 王與諸臣，四事供養，其八萬四千諸小國王，離家來久，即啟大王，欲辭還國，
translation: The king and his ministers offered four kinds of offerings to the Buddha. Having been away from home for a long time, the eighty-four thousand kings of small countries informed the great king that they wished to depart and return home.

source_sentence: 王即聽之。
translation: The king then listened to it.

source_sentence: 因啟王曰：『此中快士，其數甚眾，願王垂愍，減省少許，與臣供養，
translation: He said to the king, “There are so many cheerful gentlemen in this assembly. May Your Majesty have mercy on me and give me as an offering a small amount of food for your sake.” The king’s treasury councilor replied:

source_sentence: 願使將來共享斯福。』
translation: May I be allowed to share this merit in the future?'

source_sentence: 於時大王，即以四方辟支佛，與諸小王，隨時供養，經八萬四千歲。
translation: The great king then made offerings to the pratyekabuddhas of the four directions and the lesser kings at any time for 84,000 years.

source_sentence: 諸王臣民，命終之後，皆得生天。」
translation: The king's ministers and people will all be born in heaven after their lives end.

translation: The Buddha told the monks, I want to know that the king who made me a slave at the time is now my father, King Baijing.

source_sentence: 爾時提婆跋提夫人者，今現我母摩訶摩耶是。
translation: At the time, that woman Devabhadra was now my mother Mahāmaudgalyāyana.

source_sentence: 爾時提婆令奴王者，今我身是。
translation: At the time, Deva caused the king to become a slave, and now I am him.

source_sentence: 爾時五百太子者，今此五百釋是。
translation: The five hundred princes at that time are now the five hundred Śākyamunis.

source_sentence: 我乃爾時，於諸人中，最為尊妙；
translation: At that time I was the most distinguished among all the people there.

source_sentence: 吾今成佛，眾相具足，於此眾中，最為奇妙。」
translation: Now that I've become a buddha, I'm endowed with all the characteristics, which are most marvelous among these people.

translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta Grove in Śrāvastī.

translation: At that time Devadatta renounced the householder’s life albeit for profit. Because of his ignorance he committed three heinous crimes, pushing the Buddha up a mountain to crush him and injuring him with his feet and fingers.

translation: Even if he releases a black elephant, he wants to cause it to harm the Buddha and separate the two groups of monks and nuns from the two sects of the saṃgha, killing the monks and nuns who have exhausted their contaminants.

translation: Because of this, killing sentient beings is doubtful and fearful and will result in subsequent retribution.

source_sentence: 信敬心生，喪斷善根。」
translation: Faith and respect arise, and they lose their good roots.

translation: They create unwholesome actions, destroy good roots, and humiliate the Śākyamuni seeds.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊，告阿難言：「提婆達多，非但今世為利養故斷破善根，過去世時亦貪利養喪身失命。」
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed Ānanda, Not only did Devadatta cut off his good roots for profit in this life but he also lost his body and life in a past life because of craving profit.

source_sentence: 阿難白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Ānanda said to the Buddha, Bhagavān!

translation: What happened to Devadatta in a past life when he lost his body out of greed for profit?

translation: In an immeasurable, inconceivable, and incalculable eon of the past, there was a country named Vārāṇasī in this Jambudvīpa.

source_sentence: 時有薩薄名摩訶夜移，其婦懷妊，自然仁善，意性柔和。
translation: At the time, there was a sattva named Mahāyāyana who was pregnant with a woman named Mahāyāyana, naturally benevolent and good-natured, and of gentle disposition.

source_sentence: 月滿生男，形體端正，父母愛念，施設美饍，延請親戚并諸相師，共相娛樂，
translation: The full moon gave birth to a boy, handsome and handsome in appearance, beloved by his parents and loved by the gods. They arranged beautiful feasts for each other and invited their relatives and soothsayers to entertain him.

source_sentence: 抱兒示眾，為其立字。
translation: He embraced his child and showed it to the crowd, establishing a word for him.

source_sentence: 相師問言：『此兒受胎已來，有何瑞應？』
translation: The master of signs asked, 'What's the auspicious sign associated with this child since he was born in the womb?'

source_sentence: 其父答言：『受胎已來，其婦自然，慈心和善。』
translation: The father answered, 'After she was born, that woman naturally had a compassionate and peaceful mind.'

source_sentence: 相師即為立字，名為善求。
translation: The master of characteristics then establishes the word for it, which is called well-sought.

source_sentence: 乳哺長大，好積諸德，慈愍眾生。
translation: When he grew up she fed him milk and was fond of accumulating virtue, being compassionate to sentient beings.

source_sentence: 次後懷妊，自然弊惡，期滿生男，形體醜陋。
translation: Later, when she was pregnant, she naturally became emaciated and gave birth to a boy in full bloom with an ugly appearance.

source_sentence: 即請相師，為其立字。
translation: He then asked the soothsayer to set up a word for him.

source_sentence: 相師問言：『此兒懷妊，有何感應？』
translation: The master of signs asked, 'What's the reason this child is pregnant?'

source_sentence: 答言：『懷兒已來，受性弊惡。』
translation: He replied, 'Since I harbored my child, I've been subject to bad and evil by nature.'

source_sentence: 於時相師，即為立字，名曰惡求。
translation: At the time, the master of signs and marks was setting up a word for him, which was called bad seeking.

source_sentence: 乳哺長大，好為惡事，恒生貪心，懷嫉妬意。
translation: When they are nurtured by milk and grow up, they like bad things and always become greedy and jealous.

source_sentence: 「年各長大，欲行共賈入海求索寶物，各有五百侍從，前後而發。
translation: Each of them grew up and wanted to go into the sea with a merchant to search for treasures. Each had five hundred attendants, who came out in front and behind him.

source_sentence: 途路懸遠，中道乏糧，經於七日，去死不遠。
translation: The distance between the road and the cliffs was so long that they ran short of provisions in the middle path. For seven days he passed, not far from where he died.

source_sentence: 是時善求，及諸賈人，咸共誠心，禱諸神祇，欲濟飢儉，於空澤中，遙見一樹枝葉欝茂，
translation: The well-seeking monks and the merchants then prayed to the gods with sincerity, wishing to save them from hunger and thirst. In the open marshlands they saw a tree with luxuriant branches and leaves growing in the distance.

source_sentence: 便即趣之。
translation: He then immediately went to him.

source_sentence: 有一泉水，善求及眾，悉共誠心，求哀救護。
translation: There was a fountain of water well sought after, and all the people were sincerely grieved to be rescued and protected.

source_sentence: 誠感神應，現身語之：『斫去一枝，所須當出。』
translation: sincerely moved by the miraculous response, he manifested his body and said to him, 'Take off a branch of it, and what you need will come out.'

source_sentence: 諸人歡喜，便斫一枝，美飲流出。
translation: Rejoicing, the people chewed a branch of the tree and enjoyed drinking from it.

source_sentence: 斫第二枝，種種食出，百味具足，咸共承接，各得飽滿。
translation: The second branch of the fig tree offered various foods with a hundred flavors, and they all accepted them together, each getting enough to eat.

source_sentence: 斫第三枝，出諸妙衣，種種備具。
translation: The third branch of the fig tree produces exquisite robes with various provisions.

source_sentence: 斫第四枝，種種寶物，悉皆具足，莊嚴悉備，所須盡辦。
translation: The fourth branch of the fig tree was endowed with all kinds of precious things, adorned and fully furnished as needed.

source_sentence: 惡求後到，眾人如前，盡得充足，便自念言：『今此樹枝，能出如是種種好物，
translation: When they arrived late in pursuing evil, as before, all the people were satisfied. They thought to themselves, “This tree’s branches are capable of producing such and such various kinds of good things.

source_sentence: 況復其根？
translation: How could it be their faculties?

source_sentence: 今當伐之，足得極妙佳好之物。』
translation: Now, I'll cut it down, and I'll be able to obtain the most wonderful and beautiful things.'

source_sentence: 思惟心定，令人伐之。
translation: He contemplated and concentrated his mind, causing it to be cut down.

source_sentence: 是時善求，聞如是語，懷憤懊惱，語惡求言：『我等飢乏，命在旦夕，
translation: When Shanqiu heard these words, angry and distressed, he said to Shanqiu, “We are starving.

source_sentence: 蒙此樹恩，得濟餘命。
translation: As a result of the blessing of this tree, he was able to save the rest of his life.

source_sentence: 云何懷此弊惡之心，而欲伐之？』
translation: How do you harbor this bad intention and want to cut it down?'

source_sentence: 爾時惡求，不用其言，即掘其根。
translation: At the time, he badly sought it, didn't use words, and dug its roots.

source_sentence: 善求感佩，不忍見之，領眾歸家。
translation: He sought to feel affection for them but could not bear to see them, and led the monks home.

source_sentence: 伐樹已竟，有五百羅剎，取此惡求及眾賈人，悉皆噉之，財物伴侶，一切喪失。」
translation: After cutting down the tree, five hundred rāṣas took this bad request and the merchants were all eaten by it, and their possessions and companions were all lost.

source_sentence: 佛告阿難：「爾時善求者，今我身是。
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, At the time, that good seeker was me.

source_sentence: 爾時父者，今現我父淨飯王是。
translation: The father at that time is now my father, King Śuddhodana.

source_sentence: 爾時母者，今現我母摩訶摩耶是也。
translation: The mother of that time is now my mother Mahāmaudgalyāyana.

source_sentence: 時惡求者，今提婆達多是。
translation: The one who was badly seeking at the time is Devadatta now.

source_sentence: 阿難！
translation: Ānanda!

source_sentence: 提婆達多，非但今日作不善事，貪利養故，世世常造。
translation: Devadatta doesn't just do unwholesome things today, which are created from generation to generation because of craving profit.

source_sentence: 我於往昔，常與相值，恒教善法，而不用之，反更以我為怨。」
translation: In the past, I always met with each other and always taught them the good Dharma, but they didn't use it; instead, they made me their enemy.

source_sentence: 爾時阿難，及四部眾，聞佛所說，悲喜交集，咸自勸勵，頂戴奉行。
translation: At that time, when Ānanda and the fourfold assembly heard the Buddha’s exhortation, they assembled with grief and joy. They all encouraged themselves and carried out what was taught to them by bowing their heads in reverence.
